# Recipe: Instapot Creamy Potato Soup

## Introduction
Instapot Creamy Potato Soup is a comforting and delicious dish that is perfect for cold winter days. This soup is creamy, flavorful, and packed with tender potatoes and aromatic vegetables. It is a popular dish in many cuisines and is loved for its simplicity and heartiness.

## Ingredients
- 4 large potatoes, peeled and diced
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 carrots, peeled and diced
- 2 celery stalks, diced
- 4 cups vegetable broth
- 1 cup milk
- 1/2 cup heavy cream
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- Salt and pepper to taste

## Equipment
- Instant Pot or pressure cooker
- Cutting board
- Knife
- Wooden spoon
- Blender or immersion blender
- Soup ladle
- Soup bowls

## Preparation Time
- 15 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 20 minutes (plus time for the Instant Pot to come to pressure)

## Steps
1. Turn on the Instant Pot and select the sauté function. Add the butter and let it melt.
2. Add the chopped onion, minced garlic, diced carrots, and celery to the Instant Pot. Sauté for 5 minutes or until the vegetables are softened.
3. Add the diced potatoes, dried thyme, salt, and pepper to the Instant Pot. Stir well to combine.
4. Pour in the vegetable broth and give everything a good stir.
5. Close the Instant Pot lid and set the valve to the sealing position.
6. Select the manual or pressure cook function and set the timer for 10 minutes on high pressure.
7. Once the cooking time is complete, allow the pressure to naturally release for 5 minutes, then carefully perform a quick release to release the remaining pressure.
8. Open the Instant Pot lid and use an immersion blender or transfer the soup to a blender to puree until smooth and creamy.
9. Return the pureed soup to the Instant Pot and select the sauté function again.
10. Stir in the milk and heavy cream and let the soup simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
11. Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper if needed.
12. Serve the Instapot Creamy Potato Soup hot in soup bowls. Garnish with fresh herbs or a drizzle of olive oil if desired.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Instapot Creamy Potato Soup with crusty bread or garlic bread for dipping.
- Pair it with a side salad or a grilled cheese sandwich for a complete meal.

## Variations
- Add cooked and crumbled bacon as a topping for extra flavor and texture.
- Stir in shredded cheddar cheese for a cheesy potato soup.
- Add cooked and diced ham for a heartier soup.

## Tips and Tricks
- Be sure to dice the potatoes into small, uniform pieces to ensure even cooking.
- If you prefer a chunkier soup, you can skip the blending step and leave some of the potatoes and vegetables intact.
- For a vegetarian version, use vegetable broth instead of chicken broth.
- To make the soup dairy-free, substitute the milk and heavy cream with coconut milk or almond milk.

## Nutritional Information
- Serving Size: 1 bowl
- Calories: 300
- Fat: 15g
- Carbohydrates: 35g
- Protein: 6g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftovers of the Instapot Creamy Potato Soup in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- To reheat, simply heat the soup on the stovetop over medium heat until warmed through, stirring occasionally.

## Frequently Asked Questions
1. Can I freeze the Instapot Creamy Potato Soup?
   - Yes, you can freeze the soup for up to 3 months. Allow it to cool completely before transferring it to freezer-safe containers or bags. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.
2. Can I use different types of potatoes?
   - Yes, you can use different types of potatoes, such as Yukon gold or russet potatoes. Keep in mind that the texture and flavor may vary slightly.
3. Can I use chicken broth instead of vegetable broth?
   - Yes, you can use chicken broth if you prefer a non-vegetarian version of the soup.
